availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Norman Taylor (Fulton County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Abigail Daulton Taylor in Fulton County in September 1853. Father of Sarah “Sallie” Ann Taylor and Jennie Taylor. Married to Anna Barbary Leap Taylor in Obion County, Tennessee, on June 11, 1863. Served in the 5th Tennessee Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from May 25. 1861, to July 22, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, District 1, p. 210B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Lodgetown, Enumeration District: 201, p. 316D.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Fulton County Marriages, 1845-1875, Film #000321403, p. 339 of 521 of microfilm.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002. Nashville, TN: Tennessee State Library and Archives. Microfilm.
_ Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Fulton County Wills, 1845-1923), p. 128 of 344 of microfilm (Accessed through ancestry.com on September 21, 2020).
_Kentucky Confederate Pension Records (1912-1930), KDLA, Fulton County Pensions, Taylor (accessed through ancestry.com on.September 21, 2020).
Find A Grave, “George Norman Taylor (1821-1883)," Memorial #77859184, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77859184/george-norman-taylor (accessed September 21, 2020).
